intro: Eriospermum macgregoriorum, commonly known as the Macgregor's eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that are often surrounded by pale green bracts, and its seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, woolly pappus. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
